document_data.name: Treant sap
document_data.mainbody: '''Treant sap''', referred to regionally in [[Cormyr]] as '''larlyn''', was the resinous lifeblood of [[treant]]s.{{Cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2009)/09-30 - Cormyrean Laws Regarding Dryad & Treant Sap}}
document_data.Regulations: * According to the [[Laws of Cormyr]], treants were considered to be "of the heart of Cormyr", meaning property of the ruling family. Therefore, only members of the ruling family, or regents, could harvest them for their sap, or direct others to do so, and likewise were the only ones allowed to make use of the substance. It was illegal for anyone else to do so and a monetary charge would be pressed if caught, with the severity depending upon whether the sap was given willingly or obtained through coercion.
document_data.Usages:
* The sap of a treant could be used an ingredient in a variety of different [[potion]]s, often being used for the crafting of potions by treants themselves.{{Cite dragon/79/The ecology of the treant|8}} Some potions that could use or required treant sap included ''[[potion of longevity|potions of longevity]]''<ref> ''[[potion of plant control|potions of plant control]]''{{Cite dragon/130/Better Living Through Alchemy|42}}<ref> (requiring {{SI|2|ounce|long=yes}} according to some{{Cite dragon/110/Cult of the Dragon|9}}
* Treant sap could be used as a [[metamagic]] component to empower the [[spell]] ''[[goodberry]]''.
* [[Cormanthor violet fungus]] live in a symbiotic relationship with treants, protecting them against predators in return for being able to feed off of their sap.<ref>
* In the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], some were known to enchant [[vial]]s of treant sap that could be injected to fortify a body.<ref>
